alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Coastal York; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 12 at 6:49PM EST until January 13 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 3 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Historic water levels are expected to result in widespread moderate to major coastal flooding. The peak storm surge is expected to reach 3 to 3.5 feet. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York, Coastal Cumberland, Sagadahoc, Lincoln, Knox and Coastal Waldo Counties. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 3 PM EST Saturday. * TIDAL FLOOD IMPACTS..There is significant to locally serious threat to property. Many coastal communities will experience damage. Numerous structures will flood with inundation water depth of three feet or greater resulting in major damage to vulnerable homes and businesses near the waterfront. Many coastal communities will experience damage. Numerous structures will be severely flooded, resulting in some neighborhoods becoming isolated. Evacuations will be necessary in some areas. Flood waters will extend well inland in riverine tidal areas. * WAVE IMPACTS...Expect moderate to locally significant beach erosion with considerable erosion of protected dune structures due to large breaking waves. Splash-over may lead to ponding of water behind dune structures and result in some flooding of roads and vulnerable structures. Small rocks associated with splash- over may result in damage to passing vehicles or pedestrians. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
